701800f-b.title: Bronx: Soundview Avenue - Stephens Avenue
701800f-b.text:
(1)
Soundview Ave., west side, between Stephen's Ave. and the tip
of Clason's Point (approrimate location), whowing the remains of
The Thomas Cornell farm house which was burned by the IIndians
about 1645. Many stones from the remains were later incorporated
in the Clason's Point Inn. For additional data see Jenkins' Story
of the Bronx, p 403.
1890.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Part of the same. In the center can be seen the outline of
the fireplace in the old Cornell house.
1890.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
CREDIT LINE IEPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
701800f-b.folder: Soundview Avenue & Stephens Avenue, Bronx, NY

704230f-a.title: Bronx: Soundview Avenue - Stephens Avenue
704230f-a.text:
Soundview Avenue, at the S. E. corner of Gildersleeve
Avenue, showing the headquarters of Sunshine Sonnick Post
No. 1408, Veteraanus of Foreign Wnrs.
July 29, 1928
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
